content.title: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana: Per Drop More Crop
content.department: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
content.details: The scheme 'Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana: Per Drop More Crop' was launched by the Dept. of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare, Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare, Govt. of India on 1st July 2015. The scheme mainly focuses on enhancing water use efficiency at the farm level through Micro Irrigation (Drip and Sprinkler Irrigation System). Besides, it also supports micro-level water storage, and water conservation/management activities (Other Interventions) to supplement source creation for Micro Irrigation.
benefits: Financial assistance to farmers for the installation of irrigation components under Micro Irrigation.
Installation of drip or sprinkler irrigation in the farmers’ field for selected crops.
Direct Benefit Transfer into the accounts of farmers.
Farmers can also avail benefits like water harvesting structures both at individual and community levels.
eligibility: The applicant should be a citizen of India.
All the farmers of the State & Union Territory are eligible to take the benefits of this scheme.
The subsidy payable to the beneficiary will be limited to an overall ceiling of 5 hectares per beneficiary.
content.application_process: Offline. Farmers may contact their Block/District Agriculture Office through their respective Gram Panchayat to apply.

faqs.question: What does this scheme focus on?
faqs.answer: The scheme mainly focuses on enhancing water use efficiency at the farm level through Micro Irrigation.

faqs.question: Which Ministry has Launched the Scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare, Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare, Government of India.

faqs.question: When was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: The scheme was launched on 1st July 2015.

faqs.question: Is it a centrally sponsored scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is a centrally sponsored scheme.

faqs.question: How will farmers be benefited from the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, farmers may get support for their farm ponds and means of micro-irrigation like sprinkler irrigation & drip irrigation equipment.
